CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1970, pg. 17, reads: "AWARDEES...Pittsburgh Clubs United recently honored members of the community with plaques and trophies during their Extravaganza '70 Cabaret at the William Penn Hotel. Pittsburgh Clubs United is a federation of civic and social groups enjoined for the betterment of the black community.  Shown left to right are: Atty. Tom Harper, accepting for K. Leroy Irvis; Judge Henry R. Smith, accepting for Matthew Moore; Gladys Coffee Harper, Ken Morris, President of Pittsburgh Clubs United; Hyman Goldberg, Richard E. Harris, Tim Stevens, and Tommy Howell, accepting for Talk Magazine.  in background is Bill Powell, MC for the affair starring the Impression, and featuring the Young Design. - HARRIS Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of awardees Tom Harper, Judge Henry R. Smith, unknown, Gladys Coffee Harper, Ken Morris, Hyman Goldberg, Richard E. Harris, Tim Stevens, and Tommy Howell, with Bill Powell in background, posed in grand ballroom of William Penn Hotel
